revised_title: The Relationship Between Antagonistic Muscle Reflexes and Compound Stimulation
tldr: The author conducted experiments on a decerebrate cat to study the relationship between the magnitudes of reflex shortening in two antagonistic muscles during compound stimulation. They discovered a linear relationship between the remaining shortening in both muscles when the stimulation was compounded. This relationship, called "constancy of sum," suggests that the lengths of the antagonistic muscles remain adjusted for each other during reflex activity.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
